reasoning: Lung adenocarcinoma (non-small cell) has global incidence ~15-20 per 100k. Stage IV (metastatic) represents ~25-30% of diagnoses at presentation, with additional recurrent metastatic cases. Estimated ~8.5 per 100k for stage IV adenocarcinoma at diagnosis/recurrence. Based on GLOBOCAN data and lung cancer registry studies.
source: GLOBOCAN 2005 (IARC), SEER Cancer Registry, International Association for the Study of Lung Cancer
